Description: Pre-Training is dedicated to the creation of SOTA pretrained foundation models, rewarding contributors for achieving top performance on selected open datasets. Functioning as a continuous benchmark, the models that excel in head-to-head loss comparisons on evaluation data receive the highest rewards. The subnet has successfully developed models with 700 million and 7 billion parameters that outperform industry-leading counterparts like GPT-2 Large and Falcon-7B.
Coldint is dedicated to the collective training of AI models by incentivizing contributors to collaborate on models, code, and insights.

EdgeMaxxing is focused on optimizing AI models for consumer devices, starting with Stable Diffusion XL on the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090. By optimizing popular models for edge devices, the subnet aims to transform idle computing resources into valuable contributors to decentralized inference networks.

Dippy is focused on developing open-source roleplay LLMs. Contributors train, fine-tune, or merge models to create unique roleplay LLMs. These models are then evaluated and ranked based on specific metrics like empathy and conciseness.
OMEGA Any-to-Any specializes in developing SOTA multimodal models that excel across text, video, audio, and image modalities.

Fine-Tuning is focused on the production of fine-tuned models. Contributors are rewarded based on their models' head-to-head scores, with evaluations based on a continuous stream of synthetic data generated by the top LLMs. The evaluation data setup helps reduce the potential of the benchmark being gamed.

MyShell TTS is focused on creating text-to-speech (TTS) models. The initial goal is to develop models that can accurately imitate specific voices, with rotating challenges introducing new voices. The long-term aim is to build a fast-clone model adaptable to various speakers.
LogicNet focuses on developing open-source mathematics and detailed data analysis models.
De-Val is focused on providing objective and reliable evaluations of LLM outputs, identifying issues like hallucinations, misattributions, relevancy, and summary completeness.

OMEGA Labs incentivizes the collection of open multimodal data to accelerate AGI research and development. Contributors capture videos with metadata such as title, tags, and descriptions, obtain ImageBind embeddings for video, audio, and captions, and upload them, creating one of the largest open-source multimodal datasets.

Dataverse is focused on distributed data scraping to create datasets for training and other applications. It directs contributors to specific data sources for scraping and incentivizes them to store the data, ensuring easy retrieval and accessibility.

ReadyAI is focused on data structuring, incentivizing the transformation of unstructured data from sources like videos, podcasts, text, and images into structured formats suitable for training AI models.

Chunking is focused on advancing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). The subnet incentivizes the creation, hosting, and serving of intelligent chunking systems that optimize intrachunk similarity and interchunk dissimilarity, enhancing the efficiency and accuracy of data retrieval and processing.
Masa focuses on decentralized data scraping, offering an alternative to traditional centralized services like BrightData and Apify.

Omron is focused on verifying intelligence using a zero-knowledge machine learning (zk-ML) framework that employs zk proofs to ensure the computational integrity of AI inferences. Contributors are incentivized to develop GPU-optimized proving systems, rewarding miners for creating succinct, efficient models that integrate zk proving mechanisms.

Horde is a cloud platform dedicated to networkless GPU-equipped servers. It implements hardware classes to establish a free market that optimizes for cost-effectiveness over merely the strongest hardware.

Neural Internet is a compute-composable subnet designed to integrate various centralized and decentralized cloud platforms, such as Runpod, Lambda, Akash, and AWS, into a unified system, facilitating seamless compute composability across these different platforms.

Targon specializes in delivering accurate and rapid responses for LLMs. The subnet employs its Redundant Deterministic Verification mechanism to ensure that contributors are running the correct models and handle user-submitted inputs accurately.

Vision specializes in large-scale distributed inference, providing access to the top open-source LLMs, image generation models, and other miscellaneous models, such as embedding models. With an average response time of 300ms and a throughput of 45 tokens per second, Vision delivers both speed and reliability.
Three Gen incentivizes the development of AI models for generating 3D digital assets and the creation of synthetic 3D model datasets.

Cortex.t delivers reliable, high-quality text and image responses by incentivizing miners to contribute API keys to top AI models, allowing subnet traffic to be processed through these keys. The subnet also aggregates prompt-response pairs to create a comprehensive synthetic dataset.

SocialTensor incentivizes miners to scale computational resources for text and image generation models. Contributors commit to a model type and generation volume, with new models and features introduced based on usage demand.
TensorAlchemy specializes in image generation, incorporating a human scoring element where contributors provide feedback to refine and optimize AI outputs.
Apex is focused on producing agentic workflows in conjunction with LLMs that surpass the capabilities of proprietary models at specific tasks.

GEN42 is an AI coding assistant for for intelligence code generation, completion, and interactive Q&A. Contributors are incentivized to create tools that streamline the coding workflow, allowing developers to concentrate on creativity and problem-solving.
BitAgent incentivizes the development and hosting of AI models that handle daily tasks, providing personalized assistance and automating workflows to enhance productivity.

Sturdy is focused on the creation of autonomous DeFi yield optimizers. Contributors develop algorithms to allocate assets among a fixed set of strategies or 'pools' with varying interest rates to maximize yield.

The Proprietary Trading Network incentivizes the contribution of profitable trading strategies across various financial markets. Contributors who provide the best trading signals receive the highest rewards, attracting skilled traders, data scientists, and machine learning teams to compete.
BitMind is focused on detecting AI-generated media. Contributors are incentivized to create advanced models that can reliably differentiate between authentic and fabricated content.
It's AI incentivizes the development of systems that can identify LLM-generated content.
Applications:
It's AI == https://app.its-ai.org/main/scan
It's AI - Corcel == https://playground.corcel.io/its-ai

Description: OpenKaito is focused on creating a decentralized indexing layer. Contributors are incentivized to come up with innovative solutions to data acquisition, indexing, ranking, and knowledge graphs to deliver the highest quality ranked lists for each search query.
Palaidn incentivizes contributors to develop AI models that detect malicious transactions and vulnerabilities in onchain networks.
Smart-Scrape is focused on analyzing X/Twitter data. Contributors perform sentiment and metadata analysis of tweets, providing deeper insights into user interactions.
Protein Folding focuses on molecular dynamics simulations. Contributors are incentivized to develop performant protein-folding models that drive down the cost of querying.
NASChain is dedicated to optimizing neural architecture search (NAS). Contributors run NAS algorithms in search of models that maximize accuracy while minimizing computational costs.

Graphite focuses on graph problems, which involve optimizing algorithms to solve computational challenges, such as finding the shortest path, optimizing network flow, or determining optimal arrangements.

Infinite Games incentivizes the prediction of future events by rewarding contributors based on the accuracy and speed of their model's forecasts. The subnet currently focuses on binary future events listed on Polymarket and Azuro.
Bettensor is focused on sports prediction, incentivizing the accurate forecasting of sports outcomes using various methods, including human intuition, AI models, and statistical approaches.
Sportstensor is focused on sports prediction, incentivizing contributors to train and develop accurate sports prediction models.
Foundry S&P 500 Oracle incentivizes miners to make accurate predictions on the S&P 500 price throughout trading hours.
Score Predict is focused on incentivizing accurate football (soccer) match predictions.

BitAds is focused on reshaping online advertising with its Conversion Tracking system, which ensures advertisers pay only for successful sales. Contributors are rewarded based on the sales generated through their unique links.
SubVortex is focused on incentivizing contributors to run Subtensor (Bittensor's blockchain) nodes.

Human Intelligence Primitive (HIP) is focused on enabling other Bittensor subnets to access human assessment services. Contributors provide human evaluation and feedback, earning rewards based on the quality of their contributions.

Tatsu Identity focuses on distinguishing between humans and AI entities. It incentivizes contributors to develop and run models that predict whether a given entity is human or AI, using various data sources.
